Description.val:
This line funds the Army's plan to recapitalize Mine Resistant Ambush Protected (MRAP) RG33L+ variant vehicles originally bought to fill Operational Needs Statement (ONS) or Joint Operational Needs Statement (JUONS) into Program of Record (PoR) Panther Medium Mine Protected Vehicle (MMPV) Type I (a 6X6 vehicle).  In addition, this line implements the Army's plan to upgrade a mix of ONS/JUONS vehicles: Husky, Panther-MMPV Type I, Buffalo, and RG31-MMPV Type II (a 4X4 vehicle) in conjunction with a reset program to field PoR vehicles to Engineer Companies; Chemical, Biological, Radiological, Nuclear, Explosive (CBRNE) Units; Explosive Ordnance Disposal (EOD) Units; and Area Clearance Platoons.

Funding supports modifications to upgrade the Palletized Load System Trailer (PLST) with Container Transfer Enhancement (CTE).  The CTE enables the PLST to directly transload standard 20 foot ISO containers from Container Handling Unit (CHU) equipped vehicles without the need of additional flatrack or Materiel Handling Equipment (MHE).  The CTE consists of 3 components:  the front ISO locks, the cart, and the rear bumper.

Funding supports modifications to equip the Palletized Load System (PLS) with active safety hardware referred to as the By-Wire Active Safety Kit (BWASK).  The kit consists of multiple sensors, radars, electronic steering, electronic actuators, and software processing controllers. When integrated on a vehicle, the kit provides enhanced safety features to the operator such as blind spot monitoring, forward and rear obstacle detection, collision mitigation and adaptive cruise control. The kit is comprised of commercial hardware tailored for use in a military environment and operation on the M1074A1 and M1075A1 PLS.

Funding supports the Heavy Equipment Transporter (HET) modification study for increased payload and testing.

Justification.val:
FY 2017 Base procurement dollars of $50.802 million supports the Army's plan for recapitalization-production of 13 Panther MMPV Type I (Army Acquisition Objective of 587), 4 Buffalo (AAO 338), and 10 Husky (AAO 673). Systems Technical Support of Route Clearance Vehicles fleet funds existing contracts with original equipment manufacturers (OEM) to support vehicle recapitalization at Letterkenny Army Depot, Chambersburg, Pennsylvania. Funding also supports fielding of previously procured Route Clearance Vehicles and required spare parts. Additionally, Interim Contractor Logistic Support (ICLS) for all Route Clearance Vehicles will be funded until operation and maintenance manuals allows for organic (Soldier) sustainment.  Procurement of Government Furnished Equipment (GFE) includes: Objective Gunner Kits, Drivers Vision Enhancement, Vehicle Internal Communication and A kits for radios, Blue Force Tracker, Defense Advanced Global Positioning System Receiver, jammers, chemical alarms. 

FY 2017 Base procurement dollars of $13.198 million funds hardware and installation of 377 CTE Kits for Heavy Tactical Vehicle's PLS Trailers. Funds support BWASK procurement of test assets and contract logistic documentation. CTE and BWASK System Engineering/Program Management (SEPM) includes PM and System Engineering oversight required to manage the program and contractors. Salaries, Benefits, Travel, Personnel Training and other Government costs are included for retaining a professional acquisition workforce. Funds support the Heavy Equipment Transporter (HET) modification study for increased payload and testing.

FY 2017 OCO procurement dollars of $153.524 million supports the Army's plan for recapitalization-production of 221 Medium Mine Protected Vehicle Type II MMPV Type II (AAO 929). In support of the European Reassurance Initiative (ERI), the Army's plan is for recapitalization-production of 4 Husky (AAO 673). Procurement of GFE includes: Objective Gunner Kits, Drivers Vision Enhancement, Vehicle Internal Communication and A kits for radios, Blue Force Tracker, Defense Advanced Global Positioning System Receiver, jammers, chemical alarms. Equipment Costs include Vehicle Protection kits, training targets, and Multi-functional Video Displays to be kitted on FY17 and prior year production vehicles.

FY 2017 OCO procurement dollars of $1.932 million supports the Combatant Command (COCOM) requirement for unit equipment sets to deter potential adversaries in support ERI which provides for the hardware and installation of 120 CTE Kits on PLS trailers.    
In accordance with Section 1815 of the FY 2008 National Defense Authorization Act (P.L. 110-181), this item is necessary for use by the active and reserve components of the Armed Forces for homeland defense missions, domestic emergency responses, and providing military support to civil authorities.

Description.val:
This line funds the Army's plan to recapitalize Mine Resistant Ambush Protected (MRAP) RG33L+ variant vehicles originally bought to fill Operational Needs Statement (ONS) or Joint Operational Needs Statement (JUONS) into Program of Record (PoR) Panther Medium Mine Protected Vehicle (MMPV) Type I (a 6X6 vehicle).  In addition, this line implements the Army's plan to upgrade a mix of ONS/JUONS vehicles: Husky, Panther-MMPV Type I, Buffalo, and RG31-MMPV Type II (a 4X4 vehicle) in conjunction with a reset program to field PoR vehicles to Engineer Companies; Chemical, Biological, Radiological, Nuclear, Explosive (CBRNE) Units; EOD Units; and Area Clearance Platoons.

Funding also supports modifications to upgrade the Palletized Load System Trailer (PLST) with Container Transfer Enhancement (CTE).  The CTE enables the PLST to directly transload standard 20 foot ISO containers from Enhanced Container Handling Unit (ECHU) equipped vehicles without the need of additional flatrack or Materiel Handling Equipment (MHE).  The CTE consists of 3 components:  the front ISO locks, the cart, and the rear bumper.

Funding supports modifications to equip the Palletized Load System (PLS) with active safety hardware referred to as the By-Wire Active Safety Kit (BWASK).  The kit consists of multiple sensors, radars, electronic steering, electronic actuators, and software processing controllers. When integrated on a vehicle, the kit provides enhanced safety features to the operator such as blind spot monitoring, forward and rear obstacle detection, collision mitigation and adaptive cruise control. The kit is comprised of commercial hardware tailored for use in a military environment and operation on the M1074A1 & M1075A1 truck variants.  The BWASK will be installed onto PLS trucks as a permanent modification to the entire fleet.
 
FY 2017 Base procurement dollars in the amount of $50.802 million supports the Army's plan for recapitalization-production of 13 Panther MMPV Type I in support the (AAO 587), 4 Buffalo (AAO 338) and 10 Husky (AAO 673). Systems Technical Support of Route Clearance Vehicles fleet funds the existing contracts with original equipment manufacturers to support vehicle recapitalization at Letterkenny Army Depot, Chambersburg, Pennsylvania.  Funding also supports continued fielding of previously procured Route Clearance Vehicles and required spare parts, and provides Interim Contractor Logistic Support (ICLS)in support of all Route Clearance Vehicles until operation and maintenance manuals allows for organic sustainment. Procure GFE and equipment - GFE includes Objective Gunner Kits, Drivers Vision Enhancement, Vehicle Internal Communication and A kits for radios, Blue Force Tracker, Defense Advanced Global Positioning System Receiver, jammers, and chemical alarms.  

FY 2017 Base procurement dollars in the amount of $13.198 million supports the CTE Upgrade for Heavy Tactical Vehicle's PLS Trailers, BWASK Kits for PLS vehicles, and HET modification study for increased payload and testing.

FY 2017 OCO procurement dollars in the amount of $153.524 million supports the Army's plan for recapitalization-production of 221 MMPV Type II ( AAO 929).In addition 4 Husky (AAO 673) to support the  European Reassurance Initiative(ERI). Additional OCO  requirements include Systems Technical Support of Medium Mine Protected Vehicle Type II which funds the existing contracts with original equipment manufacturers to support vehicle recapitalization at Letterkenny Army Depot, Chambersburg, Pennsylvania.   Procurement of Government Furnished Equipment and equipment - GFE includes Objective Gunner Kits, Drivers Vision Enhancement, Vehicle Internal Communication and A kits for radios, Blue Force Tracker, Defense Advanced Global Positioning System Receiver, jammers, and chemical alarms.  Equipment Costs include Vehicle Protection kits and Multi-functional Video Displays (includes prior year quantities) and training targets.

FY 2017 OCO procurement dollars in the amount of $1.932 million supports the Combatant Command (COCOM) requirement for unit equipment sets to deter potential adversaries in support of the European Reassurance Initiative (ERI) which provides for the hardware and installation of 120 CTE Kits on PLS trailers.
